Entry.1: Major Read 28th Bn reported in lieu of Bridges sick. Work progressing well.
Entry.3: Route march in Marching Order through Daours. Afternoon (holidays) went over to site for Rifle Range.
Entry.4: Wisdom arrived with Murphy. I left for front line to see 26th Bn.
Entry.5: Spent day with Battn at Pommieres stayed night at Bernafy Wood.
Entry.6: Returned to Bussy at midday – Wisdom & Murphy left.
Entry.7: Rode to Heilly re Engineer stores (saw Guards at Corbie) saw General at Rebemont.
Entry.8: Visited by the General who congratulated me on improvement shown – went to Flesselles & gave lecture on Map Reading at Div School.
Entry.9:
Weedon wounded by Lewis Gun accident. Gave lecture to N.C.O’s & Officers on Trench Raids. Wrote to Doff.

Wednesday 10/1/17

Route March 6 miles Marching Order – Afternoon holiday inspected
Entry.11: Visited Rifle Range now almost complete. Cable from Doff, also letters.
Entry.12: Visited by Colonel Smith 5th Bde, also Babe, they both were delighted – went for a spin to Amien returning at 6.30 pm.
Entry.13: Usual Training – men shaping well – lecture at night to Officers & N.C.O’s on Map Reading.
Entry.14: Inspection of 6th Bde. No bad – visited by Col Reynolds – went to see Rifle Range. Men played football in afternoon – Wrote to Doff.
Entry.16: Rifle Range completed commenced firing. Concert at night very Good – letter from Bas.
Entry.17: Inspection of 7th Coy quite good – Rugby and Victoria Rules football matches.
Entry.18: Murphy arrived for C.M. Cases went into Amiens for dinner with him.
Entry.19: Murphy left – snowing heavily, sports tomorrow.
Entry.20: Excellent Sports Div Cmdr present marched past in forms very good day but bitterly cold.
Entry.21: Depot closes on 28th went to Corps and also to Ribermont re same. First Draft leaves tomorrow. Wrote to Doff.
Entry.22: First draft left & were very good. Had a visit from Somerville.
Entry.23: Visited by Birdwood & White – gave lecture on Map Reading & Field Sketching – bitterly cold return home from Divisional School.
Entry.24: Second Draft away. School closes on Saturday – am removing all equipment etc.
Entry.25: have put in an application for leave to Paris – work finished.
Entry.26: Leave for Paris for 7 days approved – General report on Training.
Entry.27: Men marched out at 10 am. I remain & had Luncheon with M Domart who drove me almost to Amiens. Arrived Paris 8.30 pm had dinner & went to Follies Bergere.
Entry.28:
Staying at Terminus Hotel visited the Boulevards saw Opera House, La Louvre, Tuilleries, Place De La Republic – Had dinner at

Maxims and went to the Alhambra at night – very tired.
Entry.29: visited Boulevarde Again Place Vendome, Place de la Concorde, Champs Elysses walking all went to a picture show, had a good dinner at a Café in Rue St Honore. Bought something for Doff.
Entry.30: Walked around visited Bastille and Hotel de Ville, Law Courts etc went to Madame Butterfly.
Entry.31: Left Paris at 9.45 am & arrived at Amiens at 3 pm, reached Battalion at midnight.
Entry.32: Visited the General who is at present in the line, he is very fit, had 3 lovely letters from Doff.
Entry.33: Moved to Acid Drop Camp. Very cold indeed, wrote to Doff.
Entry.34: Went up the line & had a good look around, saw General Wisdom, returned about midnight.
Entry.35: Not feeling too good, remained in bed all day, bitterly cold.
Entry.36: Visited General Wisdom, still very cold, going into the line tomorrow night.
Entry.37: Took over line from 28th Battalion everything quite.
Entry.38: Usual shelling visited Companies in front line sent out patrols at night one casuality.
Entry.39: Enemy shelling heavier 4 casualties – good work done at night – went out to Bde for about 2 hrs.
Entry.40: Quiet Day one casualty relieved by 18th and returned to Cinque Ports Camp.
Entry.41:
Slept well mid-day went & saw the General who leaves for England for 10 days tomorrow.

Had sinner with Wisdom and went to a concert in Y.M.C.A. hut at night.
Entry.42: Church Parade, re-allotment of Officers to Coy’s, sore throat – wrote to Doff – had parcel from Doff Billies cake.
Entry.43: Meeting of C.O’s at Bde H.Q. had letters from Doff & Nellie.
Entry.44: Orders received to move to SEVERN ELMS as Support Battn took over from 23rd relief finished at 8.30 pm.
Entry.45: Quiet day generally – had a game of cards at night – Battalion mostly on fatigues.
Entry.46: Left at 7 am & went by car to FIESSELLES giving a lecture Div School, returned about 10 pm, very tired.
Entry.47: Visited front line Battn & made preparations for taking over.
Entry.48: Took over front line from 28th – one casualty – applied for leave of absence raining slightly.
Entry.49: Wrote to Doff – Thaw set in – very muddy and wet.
Entry.50: Visited front line posts. Enemy machine guns very active.
Entry.51: Enemy minenwerfer active, things otherwise normal.
Entry.52: Relief by 18th Bn completed 12.30 am very tired.
Entry.53: Returned to Scotts Redoubt at 5 am slept in until mid-day – meeting of C.O’s.
Entry.54: Went to Corps Demonstration and afterwards to Bazieuse.
Entry.55: Meeting of Battn C.O’s visited Divison also 5th Fd Amb.
Entry.56: Enemy evacuated front line, plenty of work, visited line returning 3 am Monday.
Entry.57: Moved to Acid Drop Camp. Bde taking over the line, wrote to Doff.
Entry.58: Received orders to proceed to line and attack, Battn moved up to get into position.
Entry.59: Attack timed for 3 am with artillery postponed owing to guides losing themselves – Battn returned to Acid Drop Camp, men very tired.
Entry.60: Orders received to have another attempt with artillery preparation, all arrangements made and Bn got up well early.
Entry.61: Attack on MALT TRENCH at 3 am a great success by Bn, and Bde 2 M.G 4 T.M. and 75 prisoners out casualties 5 Officers 90 O.R.
Entry.62: The Bn was relieved by Reid & we went out to Reserve in 26th Avenue & Crumpet Road.
Entry.63: In accordance with the wishes of the G.O.C. went & took over again from Reid to readjust the line.
Entry.64: Took over all brigade, Front part from Norrie and made all dispositions. Had letter from Doff.
Entry.65: Fixed things OK, our shelling a bit short, handed line over to Norrie & move into Support at Le Sars – Letter from the General.
Entry.66: Moved back to Reserve in 26th Avenue – men looking well. Letters from Doff.
Entry.67: Move back to Acid Drop for a rest, relieved by Reid.
Entry.68: Went to Division, had visit from Whiteman of R.F.C. wrote to General & Doff.
Entry.69: Training and re-organising – another letter from Doff.
Entry.70: Church Parade. Training move to line cancelled now going to make an attack in a few days.
Entry.71: Training and re-organising moved from Acid Drop to Becourt Camp, wrote letters to Doff.
Entry.72: Grevellers Line evacuated – meeting of C.O’s at Bde H.Q/
Entry.74: More Training saw The General who is looking well.
Entry.75: More training, inspection by G.O.C. Bde tomorrow.
Entry.76: Inspection of Battalion by G.O.C. Very Goof turn out – played football against 25th – Meeting of C.O’s.
Entry.77: Quiet Day generally – very stiff after Football – experiments with Bombs. Wrote to Doff – orders to march forward tomorrow night.
Entry.78: Moved at 9 am, had mid-day meal at The BUTTE moved to BAPAUME and billeted for night, reconnoitre towards VAULX.
Entry.79: Took over line from 23rd . Hdqrs in Vaux-Vraucourt, adjusted line of ourposts.
Entry.80: Handed over ½ line to 27th Bn. Great air fight. Prince Frederick Charles of Prussia forced to land & taken prisoner by us wounded.
Entry.81: Made arrangements for attack on Lagnicourt, visited Right Battalion.
Entry.82: Attack on Lagnicourt postponed, saw the General and was sniped at in his company with 77 mm shells, feeling very tired.
Entry.83: Made more patrolling and further preparations for the attack, visit from Osborne.
Entry.84: Attack tomorrow at dawn, everything should go well.
Entry.85: Attack a great success but fierce opposition met. Cherry & Corner killed. Enemy made a big counter attack which we beat off.
Entry.86:
Relieved by Pye of 19th at 3 am, very tired indeed. Met Gen Gough who congratulated me most heartily on work of Battery.

marched back to Bazentin met Bas and had a yarn with him.
Entry.87: Inspection by Genl Birdwood who presented medals to the Battalion, marched to Scotts Redoubt Camp.
Entry.88: Had a good sleep until mid-day, commenced to write report on operations.
Entry.89: Finished report on operations saw Bas had dinner with Wisdom also present Martin, Somerville & Slane. Leave granted from Sunday.
Entry.90: Presentation of Medals, Lloyd, Cherry, Ward & Wood got M.C.’s for Malt French, going on leave tomorrow.
Entry.91: Left by car with Gen Smith & Slane, arrived Bologne at 1 pm caught boat at 5.30 pm, in London at 9, staying at Morleys.
Entry.92:
Saw Genl House, & Col Buckley, also went to Bank re money, & Tailors, went to Suzettes at night, wired Doff saying on leave ten days, all three well, wire me care Bank.

best love you & Billie, wrote to Doff.
Entry.93: Fixed up for D.S.O. tomorrow. Bought some things at Selfridges for Doff & some toys at Libertys for Billie, went to “Chu Chin Chow".
Entry.94: At Buckingham Palace for D.S.O. by the King. Met Mrs Wisdom at The Piccadilly – had lunch with Mr Gray – Went to High Jinks.
Entry.95: Quiet morning. Went to Coliseum in afternoon, spent night at Abbey Wood with Gray. Wrote to Doff.
Entry.96: Good Friday snowing heavily, went to Eltham with Mr Gray & played Billiards.
Entry.97: Lovely spring day, went again to Eltham & then returned to London at about 6 pm. Had dinner with Sir Thomas & Lady Robinson from Qld.
Entry.98: Met “George" Smith went to The Tower with him, had Albert Hall concert, afternoon tea & Trocadero & went to picture show.
Entry.99: Went to Horseferry Rd for 1 day’s extra leave, went to Cheereo with George in afternoon. Zig Zag at night.
Entry.100: Did some shopping bought Bag, boots, watch, etc. Went to see the Bamfords at night.
Entry.101: Had letter from Doff & Florrie, wrote to Doff. Left by 2.55 pm train after having Mrs Wisdom to lunch, very rough trip across – seasick, stayed at Hotel Folkestone Boulogne.
Entry.102: Left by 2.15 pm train & arrived at Amiens at 7 pm, reach Battn by car at 9 pm, very tired.
Entry.103: Looking around generally meeting of C.O.s, moving forward tomorrow, letter from Doff.
Entry.104: Marched to Favrieul arrived by 3 pm commenced to rain – saw Vernon, also passed the General & had a long talk.
Entry.105: Hun attacked Lagnicourt, Fifth Bde did the job splendidly & pushed him out. Moved at 7 pm to Corps Line.
Entry.106: Raining heavily all day, men all in bivouacs.
Entry.107: Still raining & snowing, bitterly cold – meeting of C.O.s at 7th Bde H.Q. Had dinner with Black 7th Fd Ambulance.
Entry.108: Wrote to Doff. Still raining & cold, went to Bde.
Entry.109: Saw wire cutting experiment. Took over Support position at Noreuil, nasty trip through mud.
Entry.110: Men salvaging by day and working during night.
Entry.111: Birthday heralded by enemy Gas shells barrage, otherwise quiet.
Entry.112: Quiet Day, one shell fell on doorstep during night, otherwise things normal. Saw Heritage.
Entry.113: Had good look around things normal.
Entry.114: Letters from Doff enclosing 4 lovely snaps of Billie – Normal.
Entry.115: Orders to relieve Norrie half tonight & half tomorrow night. Wrote to Doff & General.
Entry.116: Took over line from Norrie, usual shelling.
Entry.117: Usual shelling by both sides otherwise normal.
Entry.118: Stapylton wounded, heavy shelling by huns and us. Enemy bombarded our trenches after Gas.
Entry.119:
Quiet by day and usual shelling by night. Cable from Doff

& wishing me many happy returns.
Entry.120: Received pair of sox from Doff. Relief orders received.
Entry.121: Relieved by True and Forbes came out to Favreuil, relief completed at dawn, had dinner at Division with Heritage.
Entry.122: Men bathed and fitted out again, going in tonight for stunt. Saw Bas, wrote to Doff.
Entry.123: Things very warm, 5th Bde did not get in, 6th OK. My Battn switched in carrying bombing etc. Came back at night after being relieved by Norrie.
Entry.124: Relieved & came out to Corps line, re organised 200 men rejoined.
Entry.125: Things still pretty warm, sent 2 Coys up to dig, moved to Faureuil.
Entry.126: Men rested in morning, training during afternoon, saw Bas – rang up the General. Casualties 8 Off 126 O.R.
Entry.127: Went by car with Martin & Byrne to see the General. 3 Coys ordered into the line. Robinson in Charge, saw Wisdom at Noveuil.
Entry.128: Had cake from Doff (rather mouldy). Orders received to move tomorrow.
Entry.129: Moved by decauville from Bapaume to Shelter Wood, arriving at 8.30 pm.
Entry.130: Very hot day visited Heritage, went to bed at 8 pm tired.
Entry.131: Wrote to Doff, saw The General who is going north on Wednesday to 2nd Anzac.
Entry.132: Went to Amiens and then to Bazuux and saw frinals of 4th Div Boxing, stayed the night with the General.
Entry.133: Returned on horseback, had luncheon at Officers Club, arrived home about 6 pm.
Entry.134: Training commenced in earnest, had letter from Fred.
Entry.135: Visited by General Gough who came to watch the training. Saw Bas; took men for stiff march.
Entry.136: Raining, lectures in huts, had a game of Bridge.
Entry.138: Marched at 10.30 am for Bouzincourt, had midday meal on road – now in camp near Martinsart.
Entry.139: Training, and Sports Football, tugs-0f war, and running. Officers had a jump.
Entry.140: Wrote to Doff, missed church parade. Robinson to Paris for sports material.
Entry.141: Arrangements re dinner, played football against 7th Fld Coy & won.
Entry.142: Rode to Senlis re staff with Bde, very stiff & sore.
Entry.143: Sports meeting in afternoon, visited by General Smythe; letter from Doff.
Entry.144: Robinson returned. Regimental dinner a huge success.
Entry.145: Had a game of cricket. Boxing competitions at night. Had a spar.
Entry.146: Visited Wisdom at Senlis, played football 1st round of Competition.
Entry.147: Brigade Church parade at Senlis – Genl Birdwood presented medals to Officers, N.C.O.s & men.
Entry.148: Refereed football match for 7th Engineers, Lloyd to Rouen & Robinson to England.
Entry.149: Wrote to Doff. Poisoned leg very sore.
Entry.150: Remained in bed all day – final of boxing 26th won heavyweight.
Entry.151: Went to 27th dinner & stayed the night at Bde.
Entry.152: Judged cookers for 27th Bn, moved to get band back.
Entry.153: Brigade Sports very good indeed – got 2nd place in best platoon.
Entry.154: Church Serive – Bde dinner at night.
Entry.155: Horse show – won best transport – very good. 3 firsts – 4 seconds, went to Amien.
Entry.157: Field day towards Hamel very useful work done.
Entry.158: Visited by Genl Smythe & Wisdom – Won final of Rugby football against 25th.
Entry.159: Musketry in morning. Close order drill in afternoon – lecture by Close at Senlis, wrote to Doff and General.
Entry.160: Went by car to Amiens with Lloyd and Close of the Field Artillery.
Entry.161: Tactical schemes all day without troops. Battalion at musketry.
Entry.163: Usual training, orders to move on Saturday.
Entry.164: Training in morning, cricket match against 27th in afternoon, won by us.
Entry.165: Training generally. Concert at night at Bouzincourt – purchased the Anzac Coves for the night.
Entry.166: Defeated 7th Eng at Cricket. Field firing in afternoon, dined at Corps School.
Entry.167: Two years since leaving Sydney. Marched to Varennes and proceeded by train to Bapaume – relieving 8th Bde.
Entry.168: Church Parade. Wrote to Doff. Played 28th cricket & won – I made 48 top score.
Entry.169: Training as usual. Bas had dinner with me – rode home with him & saw Martin.
Entry.170: Training & preparation for Field Day tomorrow, raining slightly, letters from Doff.
Entry.171: Wrote to the General, raining Field day postponed.
Entry.172: Raining, went to see Corps Line, had dinner with 17th then visited the nurses at 3rd C.C.S.
Entry.173: Field Day carried out, raining heavily.
Entry.174: Remained in bed all day with a touch of Malaria. Runner shot at night.
Entry.175: Church Parade, played Officers match against 28th cricket, we won, made a score.
Entry.176: Night march and assault, returned at 6.30 am, went to Bde in afternoon, saw Bas.
Entry.177: Wrote to Doff. Training as usual saw Bas again.
Entry.178: Most lovely photo of Doff received, very good indeed.
Entry.179: Field Firing in morning, raining in afternoon.
Entry.181: Raining heavily in afternoon, had a game of Cards.
Entry.182: Church parade took charge – Scheme without troops with Hamilton towards Fremicourt.
Entry.183: Received news of the General being killed, saw Basil arranged to go up by car for funeral.
Entry.184: Left by car for Steenwerke, Bas, Wisdom, & Watson. Funeral at 3 pm. General killed by shell fire at The Shrine near Messines, buried at Trois Arbres near Steenwerke with full military honrs, stayed night at 4th Div.
Entry.185: Went through General’s effects with Bas, left by car for Bapaume via Amiens, saw General Birdwood and fixed Butlers return to Sydney.
Entry.186: Arrived home at 2 am, made a big reconnaissance for scheme.
Entry.187: Appointed an umpire for scheme went over ground, saw Bas.
Entry.188: Wrote to Doff also to General Birdwood etc. Played cricket against 27th.
Entry.190: Umpiring for Div Scheme, going all day, very tired.
Entry.191: Field Firing, Pow Wow of Umpires during the afternoon.
Entry.192: Training continued, saw Bas, went to 28th Bn concert.
Entry.193: Reconnoitred ground for scheme tomorrow with all officers.
Entry.194: Brigade Scheme, General sent us to repeat where ignorance is bliss etc –
Entry.195: Corps School near Albert for demonstration very good – won a rifle match.
Entry.196: Church Parade – Bas had cable from Doff – went for ride with Bas & Martin.
Entry.197: Field Firing, new horse arrived named him “Banjo" – meeting of C.O.’s.
Entry.199: Route March – Full order 11½ miles – very good work Via Transloy – Hapincourt.
Entry.200: Attack practice – Trench to Trench conducted by Currie.
Entry.201: Field Firing morning, night stunt meeting of C.O.s.
Entry.202: Brigade surprise night attack returned to Camp at 8 am, resting.
Entry.203: Church parade – meeting of C.O.s – Night stunt.
Entry.204: Div. attack with barrage, returned to Camp at 9 am. Muster parade at 3.30 pm.
Entry.205: Battalion Route march, moving on Saturday next.
Entry.206: Battalion Bombing Scheme carried out well.
Entry.207: Bn employed on fatigues generally for Corps (IV) orders received for move.
Entry.208: Muster parade and general clean up for move.
Entry.209: Marched to Miramont in intense heat, entrained at 4.45 pm for Cassell.
Entry.210: Reached Cassell 3 hours late marched in a terrible thunderstorm to Woesterne.
Entry.211: Battalion in Camp H.Q.s at Billets in large farm, looked for training ground, wrote to Doff.
Entry.212: Visited by Generals irdwood, Smythe, & Wisdom, had a sleep during afternoon.
Entry.213: Raining heavily all day, place a regular bog.
Entry.214: Went for a route march towards Bouchasne, raining all the tine 8½ miles.
Entry.215: Looking for 30 yards range site – splendid concert at night by A.S.C. Coy billeted near here at Distillery.
Entry.216: Owing to heavy rain shifted men from Camp into Billets – mud up to knees.
Entry.217: Brigade Church parade, meeting of C.O.s at Bde H.Qrs at Renescuse in afternoon.
Entry.218: Band coming back to Battn, Wisdom gone on leave again.
Entry.219: Coy training & route march, weather now good – ground drying up.
Entry.220: Wrote to Doff, rode down to see Corlette & Slane.
Entry.221: Took the Battalion for a 15 mile route march, not a single man fell out of the march.
Entry.222: Seconded from Battalion now to command 2nd Aust Div Reinf Camp (a Dud).
Entry.223: Went to St Omer, also Renescure, had a bad headache all day.
Entry.224: Inspected site of proposed Camp at Bandinghem with Corlette inspected Bn Billets during evening.
Entry.225: Married 3 years today. Wrote a long letter to Doff. Visited Billets at tattoo.
Entry.226: General Training, paid visit to Billets. Band played well.
Entry.227: Raining again, gave a lecture to N.C.O.’s & men.
Entry.228: Took battalion for 16 miles Route march, no one fell out, had a swim at Arques on the way.
Entry.229: Battalion Drill on the Distillery Grounds – Good – Had dinner with Slane at Brigade H.Q. Wisdom returns tomorrow – wrote to Doff.
Entry.230: Saw men working, during afternoon holiday went for a ride.
Entry.231: Church Parade – rode to 7th Canadian Stationery Hospital (re man killed) near St Omer – letter from Doff.
Entry.232: Training as usual – saw Wisdom – not feeling too good.
Entry.233: Training – lecture to whole Battalion on Gas – had great joke let down Doctors tent.
Entry.234: Battalion went to Badringhem for bombing and organised Trench Clearing. Lee, new B.M. broke his collarbone – meeting of C.O.s.
Entry.235: Whole Division marched past General Birdwood along Canal De Neuf-Fosse. Raining but a splendid turn out.
Entry.236: Battalion Training in wood, fighting cleared forest of Clairmarais, met Bas who has applied for commission in Indian Army.
Entry.237: Went with Bas to see Birdwood at Hazebrouck afterwards went and had dinner with Victoire at Steinbacque, arrived home at 10.30 pm.
Entry.238:
17

Church parade afterwards went with Wisdom to see ground for Sir Douglas Haig’s inspection on Wednesday next – Letter from Doff.
Entry.239: Rehearsal for Field Marshal’s inspection, whole Division very good. 17th, 24th, & 28th are to march past.
Entry.240: Raining all day, lectures and general clean up for tomorrow.
Entry.241: Sir Douglas Haig inspected the whole Division, at 10.30 am had my photo taken shaking hands with him. Everyone very pleased. Have made application for leave to Paris. Wrote to Doff.
Entry.242: Coy Schemes, practice in Wood clearing, had a great game of hockey.
Entry.243: Leave for Paris approved as from
Entry.244:
going to Calais by car.

Saturday 1/9/17

Left at 7 am by car with Wisdom arrived Calais 10 am. Entrained for Paris at 12 noon, Hotel Cullion, went to Music Hall.
Entry.245: Went to Church Service at Madeline Church, Went to Bois De Boulogne, Dinner at Grand Hotel Restaurant and then to Olympia.
Entry.246: Bought some things for Doff & Billie, Luncheon at Le Rue, picture show, Follies Bergere, Saw Godley there.
Entry.247: left at 9 am arrived Calais at 6 pm missed Train, Calais air raid 100 casualties, to Hotel Sauvage for night.
Entry.248: Returned by car arriving at 10 am. Battalion at Bombing.
Entry.249: Battalion practised in Divisional Stunt clearing Clairmarias Wood. Saw Genl Plumer.
Entry.250: Inspection of Battalion. Night stunt. 28th Sports.
Entry.251: Quiet Day – half holiday. Bean came along for account of Malt Trench.
Entry.252: Bean here all day for accounts of Lagnicourt & Bullecourt.
Entry.253: Handed over to Currie & proceeded to Caëstre on job of Reinf Camp.
Entry.254: Arrived at Caëstre with 100 adv. Party of 26th Bn commenced on camp, wrote to Doff – very sick.
Entry.255: 2100 all ranks marched in saw General Smythe, trouble with water supply.
Entry.256: Straightening up Camp generally things now shaping well.
Entry.258: Rode to Winnezeele via Steenvorde had lunch returned 6.30 pm letter from Doff.
Entry.259: Visit from Ralph, went around camp things not yet up to mark.
Entry.260: Route marches etc letters from Doff, Rene & Sherbon.
Entry.261: Wrote to Doff, men coming and going in large numbers.
Entry.262: Orders received for big stunt which comes off tomorrow, finished letter to Doff.
Entry.263: Stunt a great success am sorry to be out of it. Every one jubilant.
Entry.264: Casualties for Div only 2,000 mostly slight.
Entry.265: Started a sports meeting for Monday got Francs (1200) from Officers.
Entry.266: Orders received to rejoin units on Tuesday.
Entry.267:
Sports meeting a great success, contests very keen indeed.

Tuesday 25/9/17

handed over to 5th Div (Denchy) and after lunch at Fletre came to Div – Renighelst – now living with
Entry.269: Spent day with 26th Bn who are very pleased with stunt 2 Off Killed 3 W.
Entry.270:
Rode over to see Bas also had a talk with Hotchkiss the General’s old groom.

Friday 28/9/17

Had letter from Doff & also wrote to her. Dinner with 2nd Div farewell to A.D.Ms
Entry.272: Pow-wow about new attack made all arrangements for move.
Entry.273: Left by Car to reconnoitre front line near Zonnebeke returned & rejoined
Entry.275: Moved forward & took over front line from 33th Battn. Enemy very active.
Entry.276: Relieved by Norrie at midnight 34 casualties stunt on morning of 4th.
Entry.277: Final preparations at Bellewarde Rdge for stunt.
Entry.278: Moved to Zero (6 pm) to Westhoek & then to St Josephs eventually forward to reinf. Norrie & 26th, a bit of a misc.
Entry.279: I personally reorganised the whole Brigade & got things straightened out had some nasty close ones relieved by Basil (17th)
Entry.280: Reorganised at Bellevaarde and went again to relieve Bas in same position.
Entry.281: Relief by 18th and moved back to Westhoek relief not complete until early on 8th . Letter from Doff.
Entry.282: Again reorganised and reconnoitred new ground as support to 6th Bde, very muddy & got wet through.
Entry.283: Stunt by 5th & 6th Brigades not altogether successful reinforced 23rd, 21st & 24th Bns. Relieved by 49th Bn.
Entry.284: Spent day at Ypres Barracks very tired. Letter from Doff, moved by bus to Steenvoorde Area.
